page.title: 08Eartham Quarry
page.content: In Eartham Quarry they dig out many different sizes of gravel. To do this they use a scoop,which holds between 3 and 5 tons of earth and then load it into a 36 ton truck. There is a weighbridge at the quarry for public as well as their own personal use. Trucks come to collect stone from there for roadmaking,and they also deliver things which Amey Roadstone (who quarry the land)mix with their own stone. When they wash the stone they get a lot of dirty water. The stuff which is not too bad they recycle, but the really muddy water is pumped into big basins where the moisture evaporates to leave mud which dries back into soil. They then restore this to agricultural land.
